note.p: German-born geologist. Became a naturalised British subject. Worked in the Prussian mines service before emigrating to Australia in 1853. Worked on goldfields in Victoria, 1853–7. Employed by the Geological Survey of Victoria, 1858–69. Curator of minerals at the Industrial and Technological Museum in Melbourne, and lecturer in mining at the University of Melbourne. Examined the goldfields in Otago province, New Zealand, 1875. Director of the school of mines, Dunedin, from 1878.
